### Problem

#### Probably related

- [bug: netrw fails to copy directory with default options #35347](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/35347)

#### Problem

```lua
vim.g.netrw_localcopydircmd = "cp"
vim.g.netrw_localcopydircmdopt = " -ivpR"
```

When copying directory (with `mt/mf/mc`) on macos the following command is executed by netrw plugin:

```sh
#                                           +--- note slash here
#                                           |
#                                           V 
cp  -ivpR '.../nvim/starter/lua/plugins/test/' '.../nvim/starter/'
```

On macos one can see a difference between commands with and without slash:

```sh
# slash after src
$ cp -ivpR src/ dst
src/ -> dst
src/test1.lua -> dst/test1.lua
src/test3.lua -> dst/test3.lua
src/test2.lua -> dst/test2.lua

$ rm -rf dst/*

# slash removed
$ cp -ivpR src dst
src -> dst/src
src/test1.lua -> dst/src/test1.lua
src/test3.lua -> dst/src/test3.lua
src/test2.lua -> dst/src/test2.lua
```

Problem is that instead of copying directory, files of that directory are copied.

### Steps to reproduce

1. nvim --clean
2. try copy directory on macos using netrw

### Expected behavior

Copy directory with files instead of just files.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.12.0-dev-1562+g02cd564896-Homebrew

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

idk

### Operating system/version

macos 11.5

-

homebrew
